city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
these are so good! just like boxed mixes.. but recently i threw in half a pack of cream cheese and thought it was pretty good as well... i just threw in the 4 oz of cream cheese at the same time as the chocolate chips, kept it on the warm burner, mine is electric, so it would melt.. and poured the batter into my mini muffin tin... filled it up to the top so every piece got a little crisped up on top and had that nice chewily hardened bottom... the brownie itself has a heftier rise with the cream cheese and makes it more cakelike, but the texture is really very fudgy... i highly recommend this recipe!

text:
Love it, but I modified the methode by first whisk the eggs and the sugar just until sugar dissolved, melt the chocolate and butter together over bain marie, add them to the egg mixture along with water and vanilla and salt. whisk the flour and baking soda together, than add to the egg chocolate mixture, and bake. they turned out less dense and I love it!

These brownies are awesome and really easy to make.  Instead of the 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips it says to use, I did 1 cup milk chocolate and 1 cup white chocolate. I did have to increase cooking time to 25 minutes and they did turn out very thin but the taste was amazing.

text:
These brownies are absolutely wonderful. They don't make too much of a mess, just one pot (and a bowl for the flour mixture which I might forgo next time). An 8x8 result is exactly the right portion. 25 minutes in the oven and they're done.  This is the first time I've tried a brand new recipe and not thought once that I was doing it completely wrong; it's just wonderfully simple. Oh, and I love that I already have chips in the house, so I can make these whenever,  and no need to keep something else in stock.

Part II: 
This time, after a few days the brownies turned dry and cakey. -1 STAR

text:
****UPDATE!! I now use the "best brownies" recipe from this site instead of this one. After making this many times I realized this produces brownies that are dry and cakey instead of fudgey and gooey!*******After trying MANY brownie recipes, my search is finally over. I followed the directions exactly and they turned out excellent. I melted the entire 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips into the batter, then after mixing with the dry ingredients I added an extra 1/2 cup of chocolate chips to give the brownies extra little surprises of chocolate in each bite. I frosted them with "Rich Chocolate Frosting" from this site and they were so good! ***UPDATE*** I am still making these brownies! I just made them for fathers day and used "Brownie Frosting" and they were decadent and delicious!

I've made these twice now and made them with the proportions being the same as the given recipe but used sucanat instead of white sugar and 1/2 whole wheat pastry flour and 1/2 white flour instead of all white flour.  These are just AMAZING.  I really cannot get over the moist quality and the deep richness achieved in this recipe.  Quite delicious.  I'll be making these for our occasional dessert times.  OH, and SO EASY!  Turns out brownies very quickly and without much cooking effort.

country:
None
text:
By far the best brownie recipe I have ever found, and I've tried ever so many.  It is important to sprinkle some chocolate chips on top before baking: it makes them look superb and give you something to sink your teeth into when you're eating them.  It also very important to eat these cold: the melted chocolate sort of hardens and the texture is perfect.  They have that nice chewy/crispy top, with the perfect amount of chewy gooeyness.  I always only cook them for about 20 minutes.

text:
These brownies were delicious and very easy to make! They were both fudgy and cakey- a great texture! I'll definitely be making them again. The only change I made was that I used 9 oz dark chocolate bar (chopped into small pieces before melting) instead of chocolate chips. I baked in a 6 1/2 x 8 1/2 glass pyrex for exactly 25 minutes. This worked really well. One note is that I think the portion estimate is a bit off. The brownies were fairly thick, but the yield was only 8 normal-sized brownies, not 16.

Tasted GREAT! i only baked these for twenty minutes because i like a very fudgy brownie, and they were perfectly done. i followed the recipe exactly and they were very good, but tasted, according to my sister, more like melted chocolate chips than brownies. next time i might try milk chocolate chips or another extract for a different flavor. i also think these would be a very good candidate for a stir-in such as nuts or peanut butter chips (once the batter cools a bit!).

None
text:
These brownies are great!  I made the recipe even easier and microwaved the wet ingredients in a microwave-safe bowl in 15-second increments until the chocolate was melted and creamy; then I just mixed the dry ingredients in with the wet.  It worked great and I only had to dirty one bowl!  After mixing it all together, I added 1/2 cup of chocolate chips to the batter for extra fudginess.  The brownies are soft, but not cakelike, which is what I prefer.  Yum!  I'll definitely make this again.

text:
These brownies are simply delicious.  I have made them four times and received rave reviews each time.  Each time I doubled the recipe and baked them in a 13x9 pan.  They come out thick and delicious.  I bake them for about 45-50 mins.  The only thing I added to the recipe was walnuts.  I dusted chopped walnuts with flour to keep them from settling in the bottom of pan, then I added them to the batter and on top of the brownies before placing them in the oven.  Thanks for this wonderful recipe.  I will never use any other brownie recipe.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
The first batch I made with this recipe, I used an 8 x 8 glass pan.  The smaller pan with a heavy glass pan required some extra cooking time.  So when I first took them out of the oven, they were still runny inside.  It took about 7 more minutes.  So I tried a second batch in a standard brownie pan and made one tweak.  I mixed 2 tablespoons of espresso powder into 2 tablespoons of the boiling water.  What a difference it made!  They were so rich and very fudgy.  I did also throw in some chocolate chips  for some chewy chunks.  I will make this my go-to brownie recipe from now on.

text:
These were good.  I am not raving about them; but they were good.  I only used 1 egg because I wanted to make sure they were more fudge like than cake like.  I did not have any issues with them being underdone or fallen in the middle.  I did think they would be more chocolate-y tasting, perhaps sweeter.  It seemed like there may be too much salt.  Crispy on the top and chewy inside.  May make again, tweaking a few things, maybe put in both eggs next time.

text:
Great recipe!  I added white chocolate chips and milk chocolate chips to the end batter, and they were great.  After they came out of the oven, I chilled them in the freezer--mostly just to cool them before I cut them--but they ended up to be so delicious--very fudge-like and dense.  I will definitely make this recipe again (And may add either butterscotch chips or walnuts)!

(BTW, it works great doubled and baked in a 13x9 pan.  You have to bake it for a bit longer, and in the last five minutes or so, I turned up the oven to 375.)

text:
Very good recipe. I ended up using chocolate left over from last night's chocolate fondue, and it worked out perfectly. Also, I use whole wheat flour for nearly all of my baking, and it lends itself well to this recipe. It's a little grittier, but that's how I like it, honestly. So if you're down with the whole wheat, go ahead and use it here! 

Also, I like that these brownies are not too sweet. I'll definitely make them again!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
These are WONDERFUL! I used 5 tbsp. of butter. The batter was a little so I added a little half and half to thin it. That was a mistake. They came out raw in the center, just like a lava cake. Too bad I didn't have any ice cream! I put them back in and baked for a long time until they firmed up. These do not taste like traditional brownies, more like what brownies in heaven will taste like(I hope)! DO NOT taste the batter while mixing! It took every ounce of will power I had not to eat the batter. I almost lost. These are way too good. My 3 year old chocoholic son is finishing them off as I type. These are very rich, my 12 year old won't eat them. Defineatly for rich chocolate lovers. I would serve small portions because of the richness. everyone should make these at least once.Thanks for sharing!
